{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3437944,"name":"Ray Flanagan","username":"FloppyDks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T23:24:51.833Z","cooked":"

Recently migrated to Python and the robot is currently going in circles. I think it has something to do with the CanCoders not being properly zero’d, but I’m really not sure. Mechanically it’s a swerve drive with CanCoders and SparkMaxes.

Here’s the GitHub with all of the swerve code:

github.com

GitHub - EGR-Robotics/2025

Contribute to EGR-Robotics/2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

github.com

EGR-Robotics/2025/blob/101012bb8b28246951ffee22816350cfd1bd0d14/subsystems/swerve/swerve.py#L37


      
    
          
  1. 
          
  2. class SwerveDrive:
    3. 
          
  3.     def __init__(self):
    4. 
          
  4.         # Define the positions of each swerve module relative to the robot center
    5. 
          
  5.         self.modules = [
    6. 
          
  6.             # Front-left module
    7. 
          
  7.             SwerveModule(
    8. 
          
  8.                 FL_DRIVE_MOTOR_ID,
    9. 
          
  9.                 FL_STEER_MOTOR_ID,
    10. 
          
  10.                 FL_CAN_CODER_ID,
    11. 
          
  11.                 Translation2d(0.5, -0.5),
    12. 
          
  12.                 FR_OFFSET
    13. 
          
  13.             ),  
    14. 
          
  14.             # Front-right module
    15. 
          
  15.             SwerveModule(
    16. 
          
  16.                 FR_DRIVE_MOTOR_ID,
    17. 
          
  17.                 FR_STEER_MOTOR_ID,
    18. 
          
  18.                 FR_CAN_CODER_ID,
    19. 
          
  19.                 Translation2d(0.5, 0.5),
    20. 
          
  20.                 FL_OFFSET
    21. 
          
  21.             ),
    22.

According to these co-ordinates, your left modules are on the right, and vice versa.
